intro: Strychnos miniungansamba, commonly known as the African star apple, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The tree produces edible, star-shaped fruits that are typically consumed fresh or used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
